page.title: 04 BETLEY SCHOOL
page.content: The village school in Betley was build in 1854.It was 2 separate schools,boys and girls in one building, until 1902.The school is next to the church in Church Lane and is a church controlled school in 1985 there are 85 children,4 teachers and 4 classes. The head teacher is Mr.R.Thompson who teaches class 4. In the old building there are 2 classrooms,a hall and a kitchen.There is a new cloakroom and toilet block which was built in 1983. In the playground are two "mobile" classrooms which were put up in 1974. The hall is used for assembly,P.E.and as a dining room.The playground is all paved with "tarmac" and there is no grass area.There is a playing field between Ladygates and East Lawns housing estates.The school competes with other schools in football,netball, rounders,cricket and swimming.
